decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the game through the use of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils, along with board wipes like Supreme Verdict and Anger of the Gods. It aims to cheat out big threats like Agent of Treachery using Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast or Transmogrify while also generating value from cards like Shark Typhoon. The mana base is designed to consistently hit the deck's color requirements, allowing for a smooth and efficient control strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing a landless combo strategy that revolves around sacrificing creatures and milling cards to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Prized Amalgam and Worldspine Wurm. By using cards like Neoform and Eldritch Evolution, the deck can quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Duress and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also utilizing cards like Sea Gate Restoration and Bala Ged Recovery for card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo and win the game before the opponent can react.

The focus of this red deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. With low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Chainwhirler, along with powerful burn spells like Lightning Strike, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. Combining damage amplifiers like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Rampaging Ferocidon, along with supportive planeswalkers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance, the deck aims to quickly close out games and outpace the opponent. With a fast-paced and high-pressure playstyle, this deck aims to dominate the board and secure victories through sheer aggression.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence and dealing damage to the opponent as fast as possible. It includes low-cost creatures with abilities that deal damage, along with a mix of burn spells to target the opponent directly. The use of the Lurrus of the Dream-Den companion card allows for additional recursion of cards, ensuring a steady stream of threats and burn spells throughout the game. The mana base is optimized for consistent performance and quick access to the necessary colors for spells and abilities.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with spells and then bring back Arclight Phoenix to deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes a combination of card draw and burn spells to control the board and maintain tempo. The inclusion of cards like Magmatic Channeler and Ox of Agonas provide additional value and options for the player. Overall, the deck aims to be aggressive and efficient in executing its game plan of overwhelming the opponent with a flurry of spells and creatures.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through countering opponent's spells, board wipes, and removal. The deck aims to maintain control over the board with cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Shark Typhoon, while also having answers to threats with Supreme Verdict and Dovin's Veto. The deck aims to outlast the opponent by grinding out resources and eventually overwhelming them with card advantage and powerful threats. The deck also includes some versatility with cards like Dig Through Time and Commit / Memory to adapt to various situations.

The deck focuses on using ramp cards like Lotus Cobra and Uro to quickly generate mana and play powerful spells like Genesis Ultimatum and Omnath, Locus of Creation. Teferi, Time Raveler is used to control the opponent's plays and disrupt their strategies, while Ugin, the Spirit Dragon acts as a board wipe and finisher. Kenrith, the Returned King provides utility and card advantage. The deck aims to stabilize the board early, ramp quickly into threats and overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells and creatures.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a mix of removal spells and powerful planeswalkers, as well as using Niv-Mizzet Reborn's ability to generate card advantage and gain board presence. The deck also includes a toolbox of versatile cards like Bring to Light to search for specific answers to different situations. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's many different colors of mana needed to cast its diverse range of spells. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through strategic card advantage and versatile threat management.

The main concept of this deck is to put pressure on the opponent by playing creatures with lifelink and strong abilities, while disrupting their game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and removal spells like Fatal Push. The deck focuses on using Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord to pump up creatures and gain value, while also utilizing creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Gifted Aetherborn to dominate the board. The deck aims to close out the game quickly with its aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells.

The deck focuses on flooding the board with small creatures and using various ETB triggers to gain incremental value. It relies on powerful enchantments like Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Elspeth Conquers Death to buff its creatures and control the opponent's board. Teferi, Time Raveler helps provide tempo advantage while cards like Shark Typhoon offer a versatile win condition. The deck also includes a companion in Yorion, Sky Nomad for additional value. Overall, the strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats while maintaining control and card advantage.

The deck focuses on controlling the flow of the game through counterspells, removal, and card draw in order to maintain board control and out-value the opponent. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Gideon of the Trials to generate advantage while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes sweepers like Supreme Verdict to reset the battlefield if needed. The mana base is designed to support the control elements with a mix of lands that provide utility and ensure consistent color access.

The main idea behind this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly through devotion to green, utilizing cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx. This allows for powerful plays with big creatures like Elder Gargaroth and Voracious Hydra, while also providing support with creatures like Elvish Mystic and Burning-Tree Emissary. The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay, using cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Vivien, Arkbow Ranger to maintain pressure on the opponent and dominate the battlefield.

This deck focuses on utilizing auras to enhance creatures and create a powerful aggro strategy. By combining creatures with auras like All That Glitters, Ethereal Armor, and Cartouche of Solidarity, the deck aims to quickly build up strong, resilient creatures to dominate the battlefield. The inclusion of cards like Sram, Senior Edificer and Hateful Eidolon provide card advantage and synergize well with the aura-based strategy. With companionship from Lurrus of the Dream-Den, this deck aims to swarm the opponent with powerful, enchanted creatures to secure victory in quick, aggressive fashion.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, and Liliana, the Last Hope to control the game by manipulating the graveyard, removing threats, and generating card advantage. It also includes a variety of removal spells like Fatal Push and Assassin's Trophy to deal with opposing creatures and planeswalkers. The deck aims to stabilize the board with cards like Shark Typhoon and Grim Flayer while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Soul-Guide Lantern. Lastly, it utilizes the Traverse the Ulvenwald to search for key pieces and ensure consistency in its strategy.

This deck focuses on using powerful control elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Mystical Dispute to disrupt the opponent's game plan while ramping into powerful threats like Omnath, Locus of Creation and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. Wilderness Reclamation allows for explosive turns with cards like Expansion / Explosion and Shark Typhoon, providing card advantage and closing out the game. The deck's mana base allows for flexibility and consistency in casting spells of all colors, giving the player the tools needed to outplay their opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting your opponent's strategy through a combination of hand disruption, counterspells, and removal spells. It aims to stabilize the game with sweepers like Supreme Verdict and Elspeth Conquers Death, while generating card advantage with planeswalkers like Narset and Ashiok. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion provides additional value by blinking permanents for extra ETB triggers. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistent access to all colors needed to cast your spells efficiently.
